Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Caerin 2.2 (Caerin 2.5; UCLL1; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: Caerin 2.2 from Magnificent tree frogLitoria splendida, Caerin 2.5 from Centralian tree frog,Litoria gilleni, Australia

Literature Information.Literature: It might have an alpha helix conformation.Activity: Activity against B.cereus (MIC >100 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC>100 ug/ml), L.lactis (MIC >100 uM), L.innocua (MIC >100 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 50 ug/ml, S.aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC >100 ug/ml), S.epidermidis (MIC >100 ug/ml), S.uberis (MIC >100 ug/ml), E.clocae (MIC >100 ug/ml), P.multocida (MIC>100 ug/ml), and P.haemolytica (MIC >100 ug/ml).Sequence analysis: Sequence analysis by Weiwei Zhang revealed that Caerin 2.2 and Caerin 2.5 share the same amino acid sequences (Apponyi et al., 2004).Discovery: Found in multiple species.Updated 5/2020, 7/2021; merged with AP00252 2/2023
Literature Information.Author: Stone DJM., Waugh RJ, Bowie JH, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.1993, Australia
Literature Information.Title: Peptides from Australian frogs. The structures of the caerins from Litoria caerula.
